name: ralgnar
text: Ray is the kind of guy who can convince himself of almost anything as long as you try just a little too hard to make him.

name: kochipoik
text: Not even that. Just don't say anything, he'll think up an explanation in his head and think you gave it to him.

name: huber
text: Life is hilarious!

name: katal
text: A comment left by katal was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by brynito, farqussus, shogun, alcxxk, clintisiceman)

name: hollis
text: The chicks in Cozumel are much like birds; they have distinct mating seasons.

name: senseihollywood
text: He read it in the Playboy Advisor...

name: peterjoel
text: There should be a city by city quick-reference chart for this

name: shogun
text: Something like The German Grammar Wheel. You spin the outer wheel to the city, and the inner wheel to the month, and the marker on the outer wheel points to the percentage chance of scoring in that month, and the inner wheel points to a quick-reference thumbs up or thumbs down.

name: riazm
text: Someone just do me a real quick favour and get all the data and create this.

name: yingkaixing
text: I'd pay $8 for this device.

name: bixschmix
text: I bet between all of Assetbar, we could get the pot up to at least six hundo. Any takers?

name: i_love_kate
text: Totally, except I have no way of getting any money ever.

name: atticusonline
text: have you thought about suicide?

name: splendorr
text: In this case lucracide might bebthe way to go.

name: splendorr
text: It just might beb.

name: wartooth
text: id pay a cool $50

name: deimosrising
text: It never occurs to Ray that the contradiction between his knowledge and Roast Beef's claims stems from the fact that his best friend is lying to him. His trust is that strong, and RB has betrayed it.

name: lateadopter
text: I think it's the other way around.  In panel 6, Ray figures out that Showbiz lied to Roast Beef about why he was leaving, and he doesn't want to tell his friend that his brother lied to him.  But by panel 7, Roast Beef has figured it out, too.  Then neither one of them wants to say it, and we get the awkward silence in panel 9.

name: hollis
text: Chubbies to both of you for the close reading.

name: shmuckeles
text: y'know, i never really looked a that panel 9 silence until now. it is pretty cool

name: philosophe
text: Now Ray covering his mouth makes sense! "whoops"

name: professorhazard
text: I think you guys are on the Nice Pete end of assuming that Ray is deeper than he seems.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I think the hesitation in Beef's "He uh he is partying..." line shows that either a) Beef just came up with this lie on the fly in order to cover for his embarrasing failure of a brother or b) if Showbiz came up with this lie and told Beef, I'm pretty sure that Beef is fully aware of its nature long before panel 7. Beef can read Showbiz like a dog-eared Rockford Fosgate catalog.

professorhazard (above) makes a good point, also.

name: cagliostro
text: That does make good sense, but I think lateadopter had a point too - look at the difference in Beef's expressions between panels 5 and 7: genuine surprise, changing to annoyed realisation. Also, Beef's already hesitating in panel 2. I think Beef may just be embarrassed about the whole fact of Showbiz' visit (and that he hasn't mentioned it to Ray), but he doesn't actually work out the lie until he has the benefit of Ray's local knowledge.

name: cagliostro
text: Damn. Scratch that, I just read the next strip.

name: fosters
text: I think they both realize Showbiz is full of it, but neither wants to come out and say it since he's beef's brother. So they're both playing along.

name: coreythegreat
text: Dudes just trying to give his friend a letter. See how he points?

name: turnabout
text: A comment left by turnabout was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, nogadas, nutmeg)

name: deimosrising
text: More than anything, it's to demonstrate the awkwardness and latent tension of the situation. Haven't you ever hesitated in a situation where the obvious course of action just somehow seemed wrong ?

name: chagment
text: yeah, you can see that ray doesnt want to give him the letter, in the first four panels he leaves Beef hanging until he just gives up trying to accept the mail... he just doesnt know how to pass on the bad news

name: kotoku
text: Ray is such a cool guy, I could of seen him just paying the bill. Six hundo worth of equipment.

name: never_die
text:
i love panel 9.
it might be there to make the strip seem more cinematic.

name: bookofsand
text: I think the humor is that while saying, "Here's the letter," Ray is not handing the letter to Roast Beef. He is instead pointing at the letter. Just pointing. Like an asshole. It's nice.

name: friendofyou
text:
panel 8: Ray points at the letter
panel 9: Ray continues to point at the letter
panel 10: (soon) RB gets the letter

name: rowboat
text: Bookofsand's explanation may not be the sexiest option, but that's how I've always read it.

name: professorhazard
text: There's the letter. It's right there.

name: sol_tee
text: He's nothing if not grammatically sound.

name: nutmeg
text: refer to lateadopter, i am sure he's right

name: epicurus
text: I just noticed that this strip tells us Showbiz's real name, how did I miss that?

name: saru
text: So does [url="http://achewood.com/index.php?date=01142003"]this strip[/url]

name: saru
text:
You see it all around you, wandering through these message boards, thinking, "There but for the grace of god go I..." and then it happens to you, and it's never the same again, is it?
Here it is again.

name: littlefatdog
text: It's okay to be dumb, Little Michael. The world will always need people who buy magazines about car stereos.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: That letter would've been 10x better if there was a Polaroid of Showbiz going "pow!" in it.

name: droplede
text: Ha! Very "Goodfellas." And the smoke clears to reveal ... Showbiz Pesci, taking his final revenge.

name: qeramah
text: Dutch ovens actually throw rude parties.

name: professorhazard
text: You're thinking of Dutch covens.

name: i_love_kate
text: You're thinking of Hugh Hefner.

name: soticoto
text: Panel 1 totally predicts panel 11... assuming prior knowledge of Showbiz.

name: aelindil
text: Of course Roast Beef chews his nails.  It makes perfect sense!

name: redmange
text: The migrating flocks of Wild Chicks are actually bedded down in El Salvador for most of the winter months.

name: greenkoolayd
text: land of my heritage...

name: mosana
text: "Awesome danger" is an excellent concept

name: howl
text: I love how they include his nickname in the address

name: direhaggis
text: Different year, same old bill.

name: kenthegod
text: A comment left by kenthegod was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by JenH, fakead, daidai, heccibiggs, SirFrederick, dumase, TonyHighwind, Scorpio_nadir, coffeecoaster, atticusonline, sp1derbaby, Cagliostro, Myre, I_Love_Kate, aperson)

name: rowboat
text: 14 lames were never given to a truer statement.

name: arelladawn
text: But RB gave him like a grand last time, to pay those dudes off!  Showbiz is playing him like a fool
